snippet: Michael Froman, the president’s nominee for trade representative, made millions of dollars thanks largely to a tax loophole the administration has sought to close.
abstract: Michael Froman, Pres Obama's nominee for trade representative, has nearly half a million dollars in fund based in Cayman Islands, according to financial documents provided to Senate Finance Committee; Froman also received millions of dollars to divest himself from Wall Street investments that rely on tax loophole that Obama has sought to close, known as carried interest.
lead_paragraph: Michael Froman, the president’s nominee for trade representative, made millions of dollars thanks largely to a tax loophole the administration has sought to close.

headline.seo: Trade Nominee Has $500,000 in Cayman Fund
headline.main: U.S. Trade Nominee Has $490,000 in Cayman Fund
headline.print_headline: U.S. Trade Nominee Has $490,000 in Cayman Fund
